section.p: The APPROR integrationAWS integrationOpenStack integrationTPS5 integrationvSphere integration software requires a number of settings for configuring its container environment. These settings are provided as environment variables in Docker files when deploying the containers. Before the deployment, the platform operator adapted the initial settings to your environment, in particular server names, ports, paths, and user IDs.
The initial configuration settings are described in the Operator's Guide.
Some of the initial settings can be changed after the deployment. Proceed as described in the following sections.
To update the configuration settings for APP, use the Web interface of APP:

ol.li:
In a Web browser, access the Web interface (base URL) of APP.
The access URL has the following format:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:<port>/oscm-app
<hostname.fqdn> is the name and the fully qualified domain name of the machine where the oscm-app container has been deployed, <port> is the port to address the machine (default 8881), oscm-app is the default context root of APP and cannot be changed.

li.p: Log in with the ID and password of the administrator of the technology provider organization specified by the platform operator.

ol.li: Click Save Configuration to save the settings.

ol.li:
Invoke the instance status interface of APP for the AWS OpenStack VMware service controller by opening it's URL in a Web browser.
The access URL has the following format:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:<port>/oscm-app-openstackoscm-app-aws<controller-id>
<hostname.fqdn> is the name and the fully qualified domain name of the machine where the oscm-app container has been deployed, <port> is the port to address the machine (default 8881), oscm-app-openstack is the default context root of the service controller and cannot be changedoscm-app-aws is the default context root of the service controller and cannot be changed<controller-id> is the default context root of the service controller (oscm-app-aws or oscm-app-openstack).

Log in with the ID and password of the user specified in the configuration settings for the RORAWSOpenStackTPS5VMware service controller (CONTROLLER_USER_NAME and CONTROLLER_USER_PASS settings during the deployment) or as another administrator registered for the same organization.

Enter the required settings. Be aware that some of them can also be set in technical service definitions. In this case, the technical service parameter overrides the setting you specify here. Refer to and for details on the settings and parameters.
Apart from updating the configuration settings, you can import templates for the provisioning of VMs into the bssapp database. Refer to for details.

You can change the following settings for accessing the vCenter:
Connection URL: The URL for accessing the vSphere API.
User ID: The ID of the technical user in vSphere for accessing the vSphere API.
Password: The password of the technical user in vSphere for accessing the vSphere API.

section.p: If you want to change the technology provider organization responsible for the RORAWSOpenStackTPS5VMware service controller, you can use the Web interface of APP:

ol.li: In a Web browser, access the base URL of APP, for example: https://127.0.0.1:8881/oscm-app
Log in with the ID and password of the user specified for CONTROLLER_USER_KEY in the configuration settings for APP or as another administrator of the same organization.
Specify the technology provider organization for the RORAWSOpenStackTPS5VMware service controller, ess.roress.awsess.openstackess.tps5ess.vmware.

Make sure that the configuration settings for the service controller are updated.
Any technology manager registered for the technology provider organization you specified can log in to the graphical user interface for updating the controller configuration settings (see above). At least the ID and password of the user to be used for accessing must be changed in the controller configuration settings.
### issue https://github.com/servicecatalog/oscm/issues/46
